Introduction

JYJ was a male duo formerly managed by CJeS Entertainment. The group originally debuted as a trio on September 8, 2010, in Japan with the mini album The..., featuring former TVXQ members Jaejoong, Junsu, and Yoochun. They followed with their international debut album The Beginning a month later, and released their Korean debut album In Heaven on September 28, 2011.

On April 24, 2019, CJeS Entertainment announced the termination of Yoochun’s contract due to his involvement in a drug-related scandal and his stated retirement from the entertainment industry.

Although JYJ's profile was eventually removed from the official CJeS website, their social media accounts continued to promote the remaining members until around mid-2023. This inactivity marked the group’s quiet disbandment. Jaejoong and Junsu have since returned to group activities as the duo JX.
